items.title: Trump threatens Iran with 'major destruction' as US fleet arrives in Gulf
items.description: The US president says Tehran should make a deal or face military strikes as tensions between the two countries escalates.

items.title: Renewables supply more than fossil fuels as Australia notches power demand record
items.description: Amid fits and starts, Australia's energy transition turned a big corner in 2025, as renewables shot past fossil fuels despite demand records.

items.title: Travel agents overwhelmed by new UK passport rules
items.description: New passport rules for UK Australian dual citizens have customers in "tears", say travel agents who are working through the night to help.

items.title: Perth Invasion Day bomb incident being investigated as 'potential terrorist act'
items.description: A joint statement by WA Police, the Australian Federal Police and domestic security agency ASIO say the agencies' investigations are ongoing.

items.title: 'Bring them home' answered at last as Israel buries final hostage
items.description: Many people who turned out to Ran Gvili's funeral hope this will allow the country to start to move forward and heal.

items.title: Djokovic thought his Australian Open was over until fate intervened
items.description: As he trailed Lorenzo Musetti, 10-time champion Novak Djokovic knew he was on the ropes as he looked to keep his Australian Open campaign alive.

items.title: Police to detail potential discovery of Celine Cremer's remains
items.description: A press conference is scheduled to be held in Tasmania today, following the shock discovery of human bones in the remote area where a Belgian backpacker went missing more than two years ago.

items.title: MP battling cancer says condemned health agency could have saved him
items.description: Victorian Greens MP Tim Read reveals he will retire from politics at this year's election after he was diagnosed with metastatic cancer — but not before one last political fight.

items.title: Otways fire eases as Victoria's north swelters amid heatwave
items.description: Firefighting conditions have improved around the fire that burnt through properties near the town of Gellibrand in Victoria's south-west, but crews warn the blaze is still not under control.

items.title: Jetstar twice violated own policy on fees for changing support worker
items.description: The 22-year-old northern Tasmanian man with a disability was incorrectly told he'd have to pay a fee to change the name of his support worker on a ticket. After an apology and a refund, it happened again.

items.title: Amazon accidentally announces further 16,000 layoffs in AI pivot
items.description: A misfired internal email was the first time many employees found out about a second round of job cuts in just six months.

items.title: Iranian doctor details horror scenes after massacre of citizens
items.description: In one of the most harrowing accounts yet, a doctor who fled Iran for Australia recounts trying to save bullet-riddled victims of the government crackdown on protests.

items.title: Jim Chalmers says inflation is not his fault but faces a rate hike nightmare
items.description: Less than a year after the Reserve Bank started cutting rates, the prospect of a rate rise is a political nightmare for a treasurer hoping for clear air.

items.title: Privacy concerns for renters filling out 50-question lease applications
items.description: Tenants are being forced to hand over excessive personal data when applying for rental properties, with new research warning that applicants' personal information could be at risk.

items.title: DC mid-air collision that killed 67 was '100 per cent preventable', investigators say
items.description: Investigators and families are calling for major reforms, with more than 30 safety recommendations issued to prevent a similar tragedy.

items.title: Telstra warns older iPhones may be unable to connect to Triple Zero
items.description: Customers are advised to delay software updates on affected devices and find alternative ways to communicate if needed.

items.title: Quiz: How well did you survive six weeks with the kids at home?
items.description: We made it. The kids are returning to school. See how much you learned during the most recent, interminable school holiday period with our quiz.

items.title: Gem hunter illegally mined tonnes of turquoise ore at NT sacred site
items.description: A gemstone dealer has received a four-month suspended prison sentence for illegally mining more than 8 tonnes of turquoise ore at a Northern Territory sacred site.

items.title: Chinese authorities to visit Brisbane as baby attack investigation continues
items.description: China's ambassador to Australia says authorities will travel to Brisbane as the search for the man who threw hot coffee on a baby continues.

items.title: 'They're gonna die': How five people tried to stop the Challenger tragedy
items.description: Forty years ago, the Challenger space shuttle disintegrated just after lift-off. A small team of engineers tried to prevent the tragedy.

items.title: Chinese ambassador hints at retaliation over Port of Darwin
items.description: China's ambassador to Australia, Xiao Qian, questions the Albanese government's ethics in wanting to return the Port of Darwin to Australian hands.

items.title: Fake Botox still being imported into Australia, months after first warning
items.description: Counterfeit Botox vials were packaged in branded boxes that appear like a genuine product, according to a renewed warning from the Therapeutic Goods Administration.

items.title: 'Patience is at an end': Minnesota judge orders ICE head to face court
items.description: A Minnesota judge takes the extraordinary step of ordering the acting director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) to appear in person and explain why his agency keeps ignoring court orders.

items.title: Sydney's worst hotspots for microplastic pollution revealed
items.description: Microplastic pollution on Sydney's beaches and harbour shorelines has tripled in the past three years, according to a report, much of it from sources of "preventable losses".

items.title: Suspect in 'largest jewellery heist in US history' was deported by ICE before trial
items.description: An Ecuadorian man accused of aiding the theft of about $147 million worth of gold, gems and luxury watches was deported by the Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency before he could face trial.
